usefulItems: paper towel or nut milk bag, sealable container, large bowl, refrigerator
title: Homemade ricotta

preparations.content: Place milk into mixing bowl and heat <b>10 min/80°C/speed 2<b>.
Add vinegar and heat <b>1 min/90°C/speed 1<b>. Leave to sit in mixing bowl for 1 minute. The milk will separate into curds and whey.

Line simmering basket with 1 layer of paper towel or a nut milk bag and place over a large bowl. Carefully pour ricotta mixture into lined simmering basket. Set aside to drain for at least 10 minutes and up to 1 hour. Ensure simmering basket is not submerged in liquid and able to drain freely.
Once drained, transfer ricotta into a sealable container, then place into refrigerator until ready to use (see Tips).

hintsAndTricks: For a softer ricotta, reduce draining time. For a firmer ricotta, increase draining time.
You can use ricotta in cakes, sweet or savoury tarts, or as a spread on toast with your favourite toppings.
You can store homemade ricotta in the refrigerator for up to 1 week.
